modName: Power and Performance ENB 2 by Fabianku
summary:
ENB v0119 for Skyrim

Although looking as awesome as sharpshooters ENB i could increase the performance drastically!!!!
So no style loss but more FPS

Also has:

warm interiors
Realistic dark nights
Dynamic bokeh
Realistic indirect illumination
Rich colours
blin
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/26988-1-1353260970.jpg[/img]

[font=Lucida Calligraphy][size=5][color=Firebrick][u][b]This is the new and upgraded version of my old ENB
(http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26988/)[/b][/u][/color][/size]
[/font]
[font=Lucida Calligraphy] [b] [size=5][color=Firebrick] [u] PICTURES:[/u] [/color][/size] [size=3][color=Gold] Bottom! [/color][/size] [/b][/font]


[size=5][color=Cadetblue]1.22[/color][/size]

[size=3][color=Chocolate]Now added skyrimprefs.ini and skyrim.ini as optional files to download with my configuration.[/color][/size]
[size=3][color=Beige]It has a little framerate impact (~3 - 5 FPS) but increased:
distand terrain, (better farther away textures)
a lot better shadows (4000x4000)
and trees and other objects have self shadowing[/color]
[color=Cadetblue]HOW TO USE: in install category[/color]

[color=Gold]Also take one of the INI files in the download section. Trust me, it's worth it![/color][/size]

[size=3][color=Beige]now with clearer nights, with brighter stars and aurora, and less cloudy days.[/color][/size]

[font=Lucida Calligraphy][size=5][color=Firebrick][u][b]Features:[/b][/u][/color][/size][/font]
[size=3][color=Beige]It has the strong intense colours of other ENB's but uses much much less performance.[/color]

[list][color=Cadetblue]warm interiors[/color][color=Cadetblue]Realistic dark nights[/color][color=Cadetblue]Dynamic bokeh[/color][color=Cadetblue]Realistic indirect illumination[/color][color=Cadetblue]Rich colours[/color][color=Cadetblue]blinding sun[/color][color=Cadetblue]Realistic Lighting[/color][/list][/size]

[size=3][color=Gold]i recommend putting the brightnes as dark as possible for real colours.[/color][/size]


[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/26988-4-1353613659.png[/img]

[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/26988-3-1353613659.png[/img]

[font=Lucida Calligraphy][b][size=5][color=Firebrick][u]Quotations[/u]:[/color][/size]
[/b][/font][size=3]
[color=Mediumpurple]ltloempia[/color]
[color=Paleturquoise]This mod is amazing! Haven't seen such a beautiful ENB since Sharpshooter's Extreme Performance ENB. In my opinion, Power and Performance ENB 2 looks even more beautiful due to the realistic lightning and very nice effects. This is one of the best and performance friendly ENBs I've seen!!! Thank you very much [/color]
[color=Mediumpurple]Vukseb[/color]
[color=Paleturquoise]thanks very much for that mod mate :D
Finally i can really feel the joy of skrim [/color]
[color=Mediumpurple]Wolseth:[/color]
[color=Paleturquoise]Guys i must say that - i love it! I have tried some of other performance and visual mods but THIS one is amazing. Everything looks great, colors and sharpening are pretty nice even without DoF. The great advance among others is really nice performance equall to better graphics - IMO best choice for medium hardware. Thx man! [/color]
[color=Mediumpurple]BeoRenz[/color]
[color=Paleturquoise] I have always hated enb, in my opinion enb is just for screenshots, then i found PaP 0_0[/color]
[color=Mediumpurple]scrapperrm [/color]
[color=Paleturquoise]Been trying to find an ENB that looked great & plays on my setup. Found it! (endorsed)
My results on a core i5 @ 2.8ghz (stock); 8gb RAM; 1gb 256-bit vRAM [OCd @ 850mhz engine; 4008mhz RAM; 1700mhz shader clock] - fps dropped from a constant 60 to upper 40s with the quality version. Plays nice with all the HD texture packs & texture pack combiner, Climates of Tamriel, Skyrim sun glare, imaginator and the other 80+ mods currently installed. [/color]
[color=Mediumpurple]Aurora555:[/color]
[color=Paleturquoise]Amazing work, this is the first ENB I have been able to run!Other than that small thing, (a blue light while using electrical spell *his fail ^^)I love this ENB, thank you so much![/color]
[color=Mediumpurple]Smiley1313:[/color]
[color=Paleturquoise]I dont know how you did it but its awesome! This is the first ENB I can run with DoF on! With any other it just killed my FPS but not with this one. Congratulations and thanks again! Endorsed[/color]
[color=Mediumpurple]ibanez85:[/color]
[color=Paleturquoise]Great ENB! Very nice, thanks for sharing, Endorsed and I appreciate your time while working on it, so...Kudos for you ;)[/color]
[color=Mediumpurple]pclix:[/color]
[color=Paleturquoise]Tried this ENB and I've gotta say, it's pretty good. I've been getting a lot more frame rate that of Sharpshooters[/color]
[color=Mediumpurple]f3arl388:[/color]
[color=Paleturquoise]Congrats on the release. I'm trying it now. The green aspen trees in your screenshots, I've been looking for a mod like that for months since the fall thing never really appealed to me. [/color][/size]



[font=Lucida Calligraphy][size=5][color=Firebrick][u][b]Versions:[/b][/u][/color][/size][/font]
[size=3][color=Beige]The only difference between the quality version and the performance version is, that the quality version has ambient occlusion.
The quality version has a extra 5 FPS hit.
Now i also added a extreme performance version. Altough i disabled ambient oclusion, detailed shadow and bloom you see almost no different, except, that the shadows might be a little blocky but you can fix that with a better shadow mod which wont cost you any perfromance.

You can decide between bright colours or darker ones. For the darker ones just overwrite the d3d9.dll of the zip with the one you downloaded. For the bright ones just copy the zips files and thats it.[/color][/size]

[size=3][color=Chocolate][b]Watch the comparison video of all 3 versions. A proof that there is almost NO difference. [/b][/color][/size]

[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/26988-1-1353517618.jpg[/img]

[font=Lucida Calligraphy][size=5][color=Firebrick][u][b]Performance[/b][/u][/color][/size][/font]
[size=3][color=Beige]I got 4gb Ram and 1gb Graphic memory.
When i used Sharpshooters ENB it was lagging like hell because i also use full 2k HD textures and stuff. I really couldn't bare it. So i decided to make an own ENB. If you try it, the only diffrence between these ENB's is, tat mine is a little bit brighter, but it is not lagging.
It only has 7 FPS loss.[/color][/size]



[font=Lucida Calligraphy][size=5][color=Firebrick][u][b]Install:[/b][/u][/color][/size][/font]
[size=3][color=Beige]Just extract the whole folder to your Skyrim root directory. That's: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim.
Overwrite everything if asked.
Then go into your skyrim pref ini (its in my documents)
and change these if you haven't already[/color]
[list][color=Cadetblue]bTreesReceiveShadows=1[/color][color=Cadetblue]bDrawLandShadows=1[/color][color=Cadetblue]bFloatPointRenderTarget=1[/color][/list]
[color=Beige]It should be working with every other mod out there except 3rd party tools OSD.[/color]
[color=Beige][b]But first you have to download the enb version 0119 wrapper.[/b][/color][/size]
[size=3][color=Chocolate]Here is the link to download it:[/color][/size]
[color=Cadetblue]http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0119.htm[/color]

[size=3][color=Chocolate]HOW TO INSTALL THE INI FILES:[/color][/size]
[size=3][color=Beige]go to: C:\Users\for example(Fabian)\Documents\My Games\Skyrim
make a backup copy of skyrimprefs.ini and skyrim.INI and then copy the ini zip's files into this folder and overwrite these two files.[/color][/size]

[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/26988-1-1353753228.jpg[/img]

[font=Lucida Calligraphy][size=5][color=Firebrick][u][b]ENB v0119:[/b][/u][/color][/size][/font]

[size=3][color=Beige]You have a choice of using the Injector or the Wrapper version. I've always used the Wrapper version, but if you have issues then the Injector version might be more suitable for you.I will be going through the steps for installing the Wrapper version.[/color]

[color=Beige]- Go to the Wrapper folder in the ZIP archive you just downloaded.
- Extract everything except for the text files and internet shortcut.
- Put the extracted files into .../Steam/steamapps/common/skyrim/
- Start the game to verify that you have correctly installed ENB (you should have info about ENB in the upper left corner of the screen)
- If the installation was successful, then you can install a preset
- Download the preset of your choice and install it in .../Steam/steamapps/common/skyrim/ (the preset will probably replace some/most files from the ENB ZIP archive, let it do so)[/color][/size]


[font=Lucida Calligraphy][size=5][color=Firebrick][u][b]Improvement:[/b][/u][/color][/size][/font]
[size=3][color=Beige]This ENB will constantly be improved by me.
I will constantly try new things out and put it on Skyrim nexus.[/color][/size]

[font=Lucida Calligraphy][size=5][color=Firebrick][u][b]Youtube Videos:[/b][/u][/color][/size][/font]

[size=3][color=Chocolate][b]Video: Skyrim ENB Presets : Power and Performance ENB [/b][/color][/size]
[youtube]oZ3Dw6TM-3s[/youtube]
[size=3][color=Cadetblue]An awesome video made by Hodilton[/color][/size]


[size=3][color=Chocolate][b]Dont forget to endorse if you like it.[/b][/color][/size]

[size=3][color=Gold]Now have fun with it ^^ Fabianku[/color][/size]
